name: Notes
tagline: Notes procedurally generates melodies and beats
body: ### What does it do? Notes procedurally generates MIDI files for use as Chord Progressions, Melodies and Beats with a DAW (Digital Audio Workstation). All DAWs are capable of MIDI playback, however, Notes was tested using Ableton Live. The procedural generation process used in Notes is explained well in [this short video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Z8CuAC_-bg) and similar tools are available in [Java](https://github.com/igorski/molecular-music-generator), [Unity](http://www.tomsnively.com/games/MolecularMusicBox.html) and as a [Native Instruments plugin](http://www.native-instruments.com/en/community/reaktor-user-library/entry/show/7997/). Notes operates in terminal and generates a midi file based on the inputted rules. Notes generates Melodies in either 'major' or 'minor' modes in addition to a Beat generating 'drums' mode. ###Demonstration Tracks [A playlist of notes.py generated music is maintained here.](https://soundcloud.com/b38tn1k/sets/math-dance-music) ### How do I install it? 1. Ensure you have Python installed by typing `python -v` into the terminal. 2. Download Notes. 3. Navigate to the Notes directory in terminal: *cd *. If you have no experience with using terminal have a read through this. 4. Notes requires numpy and midiutil. To install these dependancies you can try running `pip install -r requirements.txt` or follow the links for alternate methods. 5. You may have to type `chmod a+x notes.py` to make notes.py executable. 6. To check if all is well type `python notes.py 3 4 -i 5`. If the installation is successful you should receive the message `I made you Int3and4Ite5_in_1_minor.mid`. ### How do I use it? I aim Notes at a bin within an Ableton project and generate a stack of MIDI files that I then pull into the Ableton session and apply to a synth or drum. Inside Ableton I will double/ half the tempo of the midi files and apply to either monophonic or polyphonic devices to create pads, basslines and beats. The minimum required input for Notes is: `python notes.py 3 4 -i 5 ` where `3 4` determine two time intervals and `-i 5` determines the number of iterations of the procedural generation algorithm to be applied. For a complete list of options available: `python notes.py -h`
